result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Madeline J Ferguson

defendant.name: Ferguson, Madeline J
defendant.address: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt:
9:15 AM Defendant Madeline J Ferguson in court.  Attorney John Anthony Ward in court for Madeline J Ferguson.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court conducts colloquy with the parties.
Defense is prepared to proceed to a preliminary hearing and requests witnesses be sequestered.
State indicates they only have one witness.  
The Court conducts a hearing:

Detective Eric Palmer of the Village of Menomonee Falls Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Will.  
Cross examination by attorney Ward.  
Redirect by Attorney Will.  
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
Defense moves to dismiss Count 2 and presents closing arguments. 
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED and Attorney Ward continues the objection to Count 2.  
State is in compliance with victims rights and indicates the next date and time is fine with the victims.
Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with any child under the age of 18, except for incidental contact. Defendant to have no contact with victims/witnesses/business/victim's parents/staff at facility/parents of children that attend that facility listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant not to be employed in the child care industry.

1:53 PM Defendant Madeline J Ferguson in court, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney John Anthony Ward in court for Madeline J Ferguson. Victim appearing in court.  
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Victims address the court regarding bond.  Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:15 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
